author: craigmcc
msg: Use explixit reference to servlet.home (required to copy the API
Javadocs).

author: craigmcc
msg: Omnibus update to build.xml files for Tomcat 4.0.  Highlights of changes:
* Made formatting and targets more consistent
* Added descriptions to the targets intended for human use, so that
"ant -projecthelp" renders useful information
* More dependent packages are now required, and more conditional build
steps (which can lead to inconsistent binary distributions generated
from such builds) have been removed.
* The following JAR files are now included with the Tomcat 4 binary
distribution, AND are made visible to web applications by default:
- activation.jar (JAF)
- crimson.jar (special version of JAXP/1.1 parser)
- jaxp.jar (special version of JAXP/1.1 APIs)
- jdbc2_0-stdext.jar (javax.sql.* package)
- jndi.jar (JNDI)
- jta-spec1_0_1.jar (Java Transaction API)
- ldap.jar (used in JNDIRealm)
- mail.jar (JavaMail)
- tyrex-0.9.7.0.jar (used for JNDI data sources)
* "build.properties.sample" now defines three different properties for
each included library "foo" (to facilitate preparation of RPMs):
- foo.home     Home directory of the "foo" distribution
- foo.lib      Directory within "foo.home" containing the JAR files
for this package (often the same as "foo.home"),
resolved against "foo.home".
- foo.jar      Pathname to a particular JAR, resolved against "foo.lib".
TOOD:  Update BUILDING.txt docs, make sure this works on Windows as well.
Update release notes to reflect the inclusions above.
NOTE:  Please read the new "build.properties.sample" - it copiously
documents the property names that must be resolved for building to work
successfully.

author: craigmcc
msg: Remove a spurious "nulL" from an error message when findMapping() returns
null because it could not get a match.
PR: Bugzilla #3617.
Submitted by:	Martijn Koster <mak-apache-bugzilla@greenhills.co.uk>

author: craigmcc
msg: When processing StandardManager.stop(), catch and ignore any exceptions
thrown by StandardSession.expire() that would otherwise abort an orderly
shutdown of the manager.
Submitted by:	Daved Lecomber <dsl@ts.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: If an application start (or reload) failed during Context.start(), call
stop() so that the context is not left half initialized.  Among other
things, this allows you to restart the app with the manager application
after correcting the condition that caused the startup failure in the
first place.
PR: Bugzilla #3614
Submitted by:	Sascha Coenen <account.consult-smi@airbus.fr>
